title: 5個連登帖文被CNN分析文章引用講述香港抗爭者對《小丑》的看法

replies.msg:
"After today, Hong Kong needs Joker," read one post (https://lihkg.com/thread/1619459/page/1) on the online protest site LIHKG the day after the ban was announced. Another user (https://lihkg.com/thread/1653046/page/1) called the Gotham rioters "martyrs," and the Joker "the symbol of the resistance and the spiritual leader of the rebels."

Another post (https://lihkg.com/thread/1616086/page/1) paired characters in "Joker" with equivalent Hong Kong figures. For instance, it compared the Joker with Edward Leung, a pro-Hong Kong independence activist who was jailed for his part in violent 2016 demonstrations. Meanwhile, Batman's father Thomas Wayne, a callous and wealthy mayoral candidate, was equated with Hong Kong leader Carrie Lam, who protesters accuse of being out of touch with the public. …

One post on LIHKG (https://lihkg.com/thread/1652740/page/1) with more than 200 upvotes praised the movie's artistic value and plotline -- but said "it is totally inappropriate to compare it with the situation in Hong Kong."

"I hope that everyone will stop using Joker to describe Hong Kong, as it will only bring negative results, no matter on the global publicity level or on the personal level," it said.

Another popular post (https://lihkg.com/thread/1617842/page/1) called the Joker a criminal, and Gotham a city of "fallen morality."

"Please don't make the Joker into a leader of the resistance," the post read. "(The movie) is really good. But at this moment, it is dangerous, and the danger lies in the fact that people may interpret it intentionally or unintentionally into the current situation in Hong Kong."

https://edition-m.cnn.com/2019/10/29/asia/hong-kong-protests-joker-intl-hnk-scli/index.html
It’s called CNN for a reason
